items.comment: After the shift in theme and tone of Thor: Ragnorak, I was pumped to see what Taika Waititi would do with Thor: Love and Thunder especially when it was said that Natalie Portman would return in her role as Jane, the Guardians of the Galaxy would be appearing, and Christian Bale would be playing the villain! Who knew the apple could fall so far from the tree, Waititi takes what was great about Ragnorak and doubles down on everything, especially the comedy. The movie sets itself up to be a great and compelling movie as the introduction of Gorr and the opening sequence with the Guardians was great. And about after 15 or so minutes, the Guardians are gone, and the film goes about downhill from there. The movie insists on placing these untimely jokes every few minutes which by not even the halfway mark in what is a movie that just barely scratches the surface of two hours ends up getting annoying and leaves you waiting for the movie to end. Chris Hemsworth is great as always as I think he has been great in the role since the beginning and has adjusted to so many different iterations of the character and Christian Bale gives the best performance, he can with the poor script he was given. The movie like other Marvel films relies heavily on CGI which is very poorly done in this film. Taika Watiti as good as Thor: Ragnorak was, might be a one hit wonder, at least in the MCU.

This film is a case of having a great idea, great cast, and great antagonist ruined by too much humor. I would say the best part of the movie was Gorr, who was the only serious part of the whole project.
Bad movie, entertaining but cheep story
One of the worst marvel movies

❤️⚡️🐬😅
I find it to be a pleasing parody of the hypocritical superhero genre. Stupid jokes, awesome visuals, fun soundtrack and silly love story.
It gave me what I genuinely expected, without trying to overdo it like most of the MCU and superhero movies do.
To me TaikaW emphasized the SH industrie's natural emptiness.
Just sit back, relax and have fun 😉
One of the best films ever made.

Best superhero movie ever made, as well as one of my personal favorite movies ever. Where to begin? Incredible story, exhilarating action, fantastic performances from a talented cast, ESPECIALLY Heath Ledger, putting in one of the best performances ever as the Joker. It is a flawless film, the best of one of the greatest trilogies of all time. It further proves that Christopher Nolan is one of the greatest talents working today.
Best Batman film ever made and I can watch this film anytime and it never gets tired.
Best Batman movie I have ever seen possibly the greatest storyline in any dc movie
One of the best movie ever made.
One of the best films ever made.

One of the best movie ever made.

The greatest superhero movie of all time without a doubt, Zimmer's score, Ledger and Bale's acting and Nolan's direction make this movie in the conversation for greatest ever, the little messages and commentaries on our world reveal themselves again and again every time you view and was complemented by an incredible main plot.

I've rewatched this movie so many times, and each time I love it. The action, story, visual effects, and acting all make this movie a masterpiece. There are so many iconic quotes in this movie for a reason. It truly is incredible from start to finish. The action is choreographed masterfully, and the visual effects, in typical Nolan fashion, are great. It's definitely one of my favorite movies and my favorite superhero movie.

The Batman Movie with Perfect Hero and Villain. The Clash between Christian Bale as Batman and Heath Ledger as Joker will be remembered forever.Every Character in this movie is so perfectly done. This movie made me in love with the Character of Batman and Joker.The best part is this is closer to the reality.
This is simply one of the best realised films made by the west ever. Great direction, writing, and acting. Damned near flawless.
A masterpice, the best batman movie heath as joker is amazing
just a incredible movie

I think it's the best movie ever made. Really. There's so much about this movie that is absolutely perfect that I don't think I can even cover it all in a single review. First off, Heath Ledger is the second best Joker, topped only slightly by Mark Hamill. The rest of the cast is honestly perfect, too. The conflict between Batman and Joker is masterfully crafted, not to mention Harvey's character arc. And so many iconic and beautifully written scenes. If you've somehow never seen the movie, do it as soon as you can (but don't forget to watch Batman Begins first, of course, if you've somehow never seen that one either).
I found The Dark Knight to be gritty, dark and thrilling action movie. Standout actor being Heath Ledger.

My favorite movie in all times , not just the best Batman movie but THE BEST MOVIE EVER !! Everything is Perfect , the actor, the story, the soundtrack, Nolan the best director, Bale the best BATMAN, Heath ledger the best Joker, this is the greatest cinematic in all times.

I love this movie. It's so dark almost the entire movie feels unsafe and yet despite all the bleakness it manages to be both heartfelt and deeply meaningful. While Batman is in many ways overshadowed by the amazing supporting cast in this film I love how the complex message only fits a character like him - in line with this the title is quite brilliant. The Joker's impact on the narrative is largely what makes the movie so damn good and Heath Ledger's performance is deserving of its legendary reputation. To this day The Dark Knight is probably still the very best  Superhero movies can offer.

Fantastic.
It's not my favourite comic book movie but is awesome.
The villains,the story and the cast are great.
The score is amazing,the cgi is great,the gadget are fantastic and it makes you believe that this could really happen.
My favorite movie best superhero movie of all time
Absolute masterpiece
Why so Serious? Greatest Batman movie ever!
